history.proof: intros. unfold HClient in *. rewrite in_cons. apply/orP. right. shelve.

exceptions.exn: In environment server : nid clients : seq nid Hnin : server \ otin clients Huniq : uniq clients the_tag : nat prec : nid -> seq nat -> Prop prec_safe : forall (this to : nat_eqType) (m : seq nat), this \\in clients /\\ to == server -> prec to m -> msg_from_client {| tag := the_tag; tms_cont := m |} this, to : nat_eqType H : this \\in clients /\\ to == server Unable to unify "this \\in clients /\\ to == server" with "is_true (to \\in clients)".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
server: nid
clients: seq nid
Hnin: is_true (server \notin clients)
Huniq: is_true (uniq clients)
the_tag: nat
prec: nid -> seq nat -> Prop
prec_safe: forall (this to : nat_eqType) (m : seq nat), HClient this to -> prec to m -> msg_from_client {| tag := the_tag; tms_cont := m |}
to: Equality.sort nat_eqType
this: Equality.sort nat_eqType

Goal:
HClient this to -> to \in nodes

Premises:
uniq : seq ?T -> bool where ?T : [server : nid clients : seq nid Hnin : server \notin clients Huniq : uniq clients the_tag : nat prec : nid -> seq nat -> Prop prec_safe : forall (this to : nat_eqType) (m : seq nat), HClient this to -> prec to m -> msg_from_client {| tag := the_tag; tms_cont := m |} this : nat_eqType to : nat_eqType |- eqType]
is_true = eq^~ true : bool -> Prop Arguments is_true _%bool_scope is_true is a coercion
tag = fun t : TaggedMessage => let (tag, _) := t in tag : TaggedMessage -> nat
sort : forall T : Type, rel T -> seq T -> seq T
nat_eqType = EqType nat nat_eqMixin : eqType
msg_from_client = fun ms : TaggedMessage => tag ms == update_tag /\ (exists e v : nat, ms = [:: e; v]) \/ tag ms == read_tag /\ (exists e : nat, ms = [:: e]) : TaggedMessage -> Prop
nodes = [:: server] ++ clients : seq nid
tms_cont = fun t : TaggedMessage => let (_, tms_cont) := t in tms_cont : TaggedMessage -> seq nat tms_cont is a coercion
nid = nat : Set
HClient = fun this to : nat_eqType => this \in clients /\ to == server : nat_eqType -> nat_eqType -> Prop

client_send_this_in : forall this to : nat_eqType, HClient this to -> this \in nodes
server_step_def : forall (the_tag : nat) (prec : server_state -> nid -> seq nat -> Prop) (this to : nid) (d : dstatelet) (msg : seq nat), server_send_safe prec this to d msg < -> (exists (b : heapUMC) (pf : server_send_safe prec this to d msg), server_step the_tag pf = Some b)

server_send_to_in : forall this to : nat_eqType, HServ this to -> to \in nodes
SendMsg : forall (w : world) (this : nid) (s1 s2 : state) (l : Label) (st : send_trans (Protocols.coh (getProtocol w l))), st \In get_st w l -> forall (to : nid) (msg : seq nat) (b : heap), this \in Protocols.Exports.nodes (getProtocol w l) (getStatelet s1 l) -> l \in dom s1 -> Coh w s1 -> forall S : send_safe st this to (getStatelet s1 l) msg, all_hooks_fire w l (t_snd st) s1 this msg to -> Some b = send_step S -> s2 = upd l {| dstate := upd this b (dstate (getStatelet s1 l)); dsoup := (post_msg (dsoup (getStatelet s1 l)) {| content := {| tag := t_snd st; tms_cont := msg |}; from := this; to := to; active := true |}).1 |} s1 -> network_step w this s1 s2
